description: This source file 'message.c' defines functions and data structures related to messaging in a client-server communication context. It includes functions to create and destroy message objects, which are used for sending commands and receiving responses in an asynchronous communication system. The file is part of a larger SDK or service layer responsible for message handling and interaction with servers.

methods.name: message * createMessage(uint64_t id)
methods.description: Creates and initializes a message object with a specified message ID, setting default values such as expectsReply and numRetries.

methods.name: void destroyMessage(message * msg)
methods.description: Frees memory and cleans up resources associated with a message object, including optional user data and a tracker.
